email.description: Administrator's unique email address, used for login and notification. Must be unique per administrator and compliant with organizational policy.

password_hash.description: Bcrypt or argon2 hash of the administrator's password (never store plain text). Required for secure login. Must follow strong password policy.

display_name.description: The display name of the administrator, used for UI, audit logs, and identification. Must be unique and meaningful in the admin context.

status.description: Account status. Must be one of the allowed enum values ('active','suspended','withdrawn','banned'). Controls the admin's capability to login and access system features.

role.description: Administrator's role or authorization level (e.g., 'superadmin', 'reviewer', 'support'). Determines access scope throughout the system. Must align with platform authorization matrix.

ISellerAuthPasswordChangeResponse,[objec.description: Administrator registration/create request for shopping_mall_ai_administrators. Captures all critical authentication, profile, and authorization fields for new admin onboarding.

currentPassword.description: Current password for verification, provided by the customer; will be compared against password_hash.

newPassword.description: New password to set, will be converted to password_hash after security checks. Must meet platform password complexity policy.

IShoppingMallAiCustomer.ValidateResult,[.description: Request object for customer password change. Both current and new password are required. No profile field changes are allowed here.

oneOf.description: Business domain context for the link (e.g., product, order, review, evidence, seller_doc, compliance, etc.).
Business domain context for the link (e.g., product, order, review, evidence, seller_doc, compliance, etc.).

target_domain.description: Business domain context for the link (e.g., product, order, review, evidence, seller_doc, compliance, etc.).

oneOf.description: ID of the referenced business object (e.g., product ID, order ID, etc.).
ID of the referenced business object (e.g., product ID, order ID, etc.).

target_id.description: ID of the referenced business object (e.g., product ID, order ID, etc.).

oneOf.description: ID of the user who created this link. (Could be customer, seller, admin; polymorphic if needed.)
ID of the user who created this link. (Could be customer, seller, admin; polymorphic if needed.)

linked_by_id.description: ID of the user who created this link. (Could be customer, seller, admin; polymorphic if needed.)

IAttachment.AttachmentVersion,[object Ob.description: Request filter and pagination object for querying business links associated with a specific attachment file. Supports filtering by domain, target object, linking user, and basic paging.

IShoppingMallAiAttachment.IRequest,[obje.description: Represents an attachment (file metadata and control) record in the AI-powered shopping mall system. Captures audit, compliance, usage, and access information for each attachment/file: original name, mime type, size, business domain, retention strategy, uploader context, legal flags, and access controls. Each property is referenced directly from the shopping_mall_ai_attachments Prisma schema with explanations suitable for API and documentation usage. Attachment records are used for catalog images, invoices, evidence, legal and compliance doc storage, and more.

id.description: Globally unique identifier for the attachment (UUID). Used for audit, lookup, and business domain mapping.

uploaded_by_id.description: UUID of the user who uploaded the attachment. Polymorphic - references customers, sellers, or administrators. Used for business, access control, and audit context.

filename.description: Original file name at upload time (client-visible or business record). Supports traceability and user audit.

mime_type.description: Standard MIME type as detected/declared (e.g., image/jpeg, application/pdf). Used for validation, delivery, and type-specific logic.

file_uri.description: Primary storage or CDN-served URI. Secure access for file delivery, download, compliance review.

file_size.description: File size in bytes. Used for quota management, transmission analytics, and download controls.

business_domain.description: Business usage tag for attachment. E.g., product_image, invoice, evidence, compliance_doc. Drives access, retention, and role-based logic.

retention_policy_code.description: Policy code for data retention, archival, deletion (e.g., standard, evidence, regulatory). Used to enforce legal and business rules.

legal_hold.description: If true, the file is under legal hold â€“ cannot be deleted or altered except by explicit compliance order. Used for evidence and regulated data.

deleted.description: If true, the file has been logically deleted (soft deletion for audit/compliance), excluded from normal use.

access_acl.description: Access Control List (likely JSON string) describing role/user access rights for this attachment. Used for runtime enforcement and advanced compliance policies.

created_at.description: Timestamp (ISO 8601) of attachment creation/upload (immutable). Audit, compliance, and usage analytics depend on this.

updated_at.description: Last updated timestamp for attachment metadata. Used for control record, lifecycle, and business logic.

oneOf.description: If deleted, timestamp of logical deletion; otherwise null. Used for retention and compliance logic.
If deleted, timestamp of logical deletion; otherwise null. Used for retention and compliance logic.

deleted_at.description: If deleted, timestamp of logical deletion; otherwise null. Used for retention and compliance logic.

id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the attachment. This is the primary key of the attachment record and is required for linking, auditing, and further operations.

filename.description: The original file name at time of upload. May be displayed in UI or used for audit purposes.

mime_type.description: The standard MIME type for the file (e.g., image/png, application/pdf). Used for file handling, preview, and compliance.

file_size.description: File size in bytes. Used for quota management, performance optimization, and audit trails.

business_domain.description: A string code representing the business domain/purpose for the attachment (e.g., 'product_image', 'invoice', 'evidence', 'compliance_doc'). Important for filtering and domain-specific workflows.

retention_policy_code.description: Specifies the retention/compliance policy code for this file. Used for determining purge, archive, and audit windows.

legal_hold.description: Indicates if this attachment is under legal hold, which means it cannot be deleted or modified until compliance review. True if under legal hold, otherwise false.

deleted.description: True if the attachment has been logically deleted (soft delete). Logical deletions remove the file from UI and API usage except for compliance roles.

uploaded_by_id.description: UUID referencing the user (customer, seller, or admin) who uploaded the attachment. Used for access control and audit purposes.

created_at.description: Timestamp of upload/attachment creation in ISO 8601 format. Used for sorting and audit.

IPageIShoppingMallAiAttachment.ISummary,.description:
Summary view of an attachment file managed by the shoppingMallAi platform. Contains only non-sensitive, business-relevant, or compliance-filtered fields suitable for list/search display, not the full attachment or all detailed audit fields.

This schema is used in paginated attachment listings, search responses, and summary cards, and is designed to balance discoverability with compliance and privacy filtering.
